e4: I recommend changing to the new policy as it aligns with ethical financial practices and fosters greater transparency. While some investors may initially misunderstand the new reporting method, establishing trust through honest reporting will ultimately benefit the company's reputation and lead to more sustainable investor relationships in the long run.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, clearly reflecting a company's financial performance without any intentional bias or manipulation. It should aim to inform all investors, regardless of sophistication, preventing misleading interpretations. Additionally, ethical considerations include compliance with regulations, open communication about accounting practices, and fostering accountability, ensuring that all stakeholders can make informed decisions based on reliable information.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team how they plan to communicate the change in earnings reporting policy to investors effectively. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to educate retail investors who may not understand the implications of the new policy, ensuring that all stakeholders are aware of the changes and reassured about the company's commitment to transparency and accuracy.
